Which of the following statements are correct with respect to the decline of Mughal empire?
1. As the central administration became fragile, the outlying provinces began to proclaim their independence.
2. Except for the Punjab, independent kingdoms emergedÂ in almost every other region in the middle of the eighteenth century.
3. In Bengal, power passed into the hands of Murshid Quli Khan and Alivardi Khan.
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: As the central administration of the Mughal empire became fragile, the outlying provinces began to proclaim their independence. Except for the Punjab, independent kingdoms emerged in almost every other region in the middle of the eighteenth century. In Bengal, power passed into the hands of Murshid Quli Khan and Alivardi Khan.
